string.text: Chance to not pick best target
From five targets with highest priority: \n "1" means that NPC will always pick random and travel more; \n "0" means that NPC will most likely stay on same favorite place.
How distance affect priority: \n "0" disables distance to be factor for priority, meaning more chaotic NPC movement.
Random range for every possible target: \n "0" is no random; \n "0.25" will pick a random number from 0.75 and 1.25 and multiply each target's priority for this value.
Mutants can now change levels like stalkers. Very chaotic because uses vanilla priority calculations! \n Mutant transition blacklist is in the main script's "local mutants_blacklist_levels" table.

If a high rank squad tries to spawn on south - it'll be replaced for another squad with rank that fits the travelling table. \n If you use "ZCP" addon and want their spawns, then I think it's better to disable it (NPCs will still travel according to my table).
Displays 5 highest priority targets, their values and the one NPC picked.
